The probability density fuction of Y~DE(0,1) is $f_{Y}(x)=\frac{1}{2}exp^{-\mid x \mid}$ 

The propability density function of N~(0,1) is $f_{X}(x)=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2\pi}}exp^{-\frac{x^2}{2}}$

$U\leq \frac{f_{X}(x)}{cf_{Y}(x)}$ and the ratio boundary is between 0 an 1 $0<\frac{f_{X}(x)}{cf_{Y}(x)}\leq1$, thus we have the following.

$$
\begin{aligned}
&0<\frac{f_{X}(x)}{cf_{Y}(x)}\leq1 \\
&0<\frac{f_{X}(x)}{f_{Y}(x)}\leq c
\end{aligned}
$$

$$
\begin{aligned}
&c\geq\frac{f_{X}(x)}{f_{Y}(x)} \\
&c\geq\frac{\frac{1}{\sqrt{2\pi}}exp^{-\frac{x^2}{2}}}{\frac{1}{2}exp^{-\mid x \mid}} \\
&c\geq\frac{2}{\sqrt{2\pi}}exp^{\mid x \mid - \frac{x^2}{2}}
\end{aligned}
$$

We need to maximise $exp^{\mid x \mid - \frac{x^2}{2}}$.

$g(x)=\mid x\mid - \frac{x^2}{2}$

$g'(x)=1-\frac{2x}{2}=1-x$

$g'(x)=0 \Leftrightarrow 1-x=0 \Leftrightarrow x=1$

$$
\begin{aligned}
&c\geq\frac{2}{\sqrt{2\pi}}e^{1-\frac{1}{2}} = \frac{2}{\sqrt{2\pi}}e^{\frac{1}{2}}=\frac{2\sqrt{e}}{\sqrt{2\pi}}\simeq1.315
\end{aligned}
$$
